courseDescription:
This free online Workplace Health and Safety training course will first cover the essential topic of risk assessment, where you will be shown how to identify workplace hazards and risk factors that have the potential to cause harm. You will then learn how to analyze and evaluate the risks associated with each type of hazard. Next, you will study the different types of fires and fire extinguishers such as water, foam, carbon dioxide, and wet chemical fire extinguishers.

Furthermore, you will learn about workplace health and safety issues involving the environment. The work environment refers to the surrounding conditions in which an employee operates. This may be composed of physical conditions such as office temperature, or equipment such as personal computers. You will also learn about the electricity and other work-related factors such as manufacturing processes or procedures as well as health and safety issues involving chemicals and other important hazards.

Raising your awareness of the dangers that may be present in your workplace will keep you away from harm and injury. This online training course will be of real value to all workers wishing to learn more about the fundamentals of health and safety in the workplace, especially for those who are working in the training and employment department. Begin this online training program today and start learning how to keep yourself and your colleagues out of harm's way.
